refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget used to guide users through multi-step operations

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkAssistant is a widget used to represent a generally complex operation splitted in several steps, guiding the user through its pages and controlling the page flow to collect the necessary data.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_current_page ()
refsect2.para: Returns the page number of the current page

listitem.simpara: The index (starting from 0) of the current page in the assistant, if the assistant has no pages, -1 will be returned

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_current_page ()
refsect2.para: Switches the page to page_num. Note that this will only be necessary in custom buttons, as the assistant flow can be set with gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func().

listitem.simpara: index of the page to switch to, starting from 0. If negative, the last page will be used. If greater than the number of pages in the assistant, nothing will be done.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_n_pages ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of pages in the assistant

listitem.simpara: The number of pages in the assistant.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_nth_page ()
refsect2.para: Returns the child widget contained in page number page_num.

listitem.simpara: The index of a page in the assistant, or -1 to get the last page;
The child widget, or NULL if page_num is out of bounds.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_prepend_page ()
refsect2.para: Prepends a page to the assistant.

listitem.simpara: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_append_page ()
refsect2.para: Appends a page to the assistant.

listitem.simpara: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_insert_page ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a page in the assistant at a given position.

listitem.simpara: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page to the assistant
the index (starting from 0) of the inserted page

refsect2.title: GtkAssistantPageFunc ()
refsect2.para: A function used by gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func() to know which is the next page given a current one. It's called both for computing the next page when the user presses the "forward" button and for handling the behavior of the "last" button.

listitem.simpara: The page number used to calculate the next page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func (GtkAssistant *assistant, GtkAssistantPageFunc page_func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the page forwarding function to be page_func, this function will be used to determine what will be the next page when the user presses the forward button. Setting page_func to NULL will make the assistant to use the default forward function, which just goes to the next visible page.

listitem.simpara: the GtkAssistantPageFunc, or NULL to use the default one

refsect2.title: enum GtkAssistantPageType
refsect2.para: An enum for determining the page role inside the GtkAssistant. It's used to handle buttons sensitivity and visibility.
Note that an assistant needs to end its page flow with a page of type GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONFIRM or GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_SUMMARY to be correct.

listitem.simpara: The page contains an introduction to the assistant task.
The page lets the user confirm or deny the changes.
The page informs the user of the changes done.
Used for tasks that take a long time to complete, blocks the assistant until the page is marked as complete.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_page_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the page type for page. The page type determines the page behavior in the assistant.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_page_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the page type of page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_page_title ()
refsect2.para: Sets a title for page. The title is displayed in the header area of the assistant when page is the current page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_page_header_image ()
refsect2.para: Sets a header image for page. This image is displayed in the header area of the assistant when page is the current page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_page_header_image ()
refsect2.para: Gets the header image for page.

listitem.simpara: the header image for page, or NULL if there's no header image for the page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_page_side_image ()
refsect2.para: Sets a header image for page. This image is displayed in the side area of the assistant when page is the current page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_get_page_side_image ()
refsect2.para: Gets the header image for page.

listitem.simpara: the side image for page, or NULL if there's no side image for the page.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_set_page_complete ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether page contents are complete. This will make assistant update the buttons state to be able to continue the task.

listitem.simpara: the completeness status of the page

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_add_action_widget ()
refsect2.para: Adds a widget to the action area of a GtkAssistant.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_remove_action_widget ()
refsect2.para: Removes a widget from the action area of a GtkAssistant.

refsect2.title: gtk_assistant_update_buttons_state ()
refsect2.para: Forces assistant to recompute the buttons state.
GTK+ automatically takes care of this in most situations, e.g. when the user goes to a different page, or when the visibility or completeness of a page changes.
One situation where it can be necessary to call this function is when changing a value on the current page affects the future page flow of the assistant.

refsect2.title: The :complete child property
refsect2.para: Setting the "complete" child property to TRUE marks a page as complete (i.e.: all the required fields are filled out). GTK+ uses this information to control the sensitivity of the navigation buttons.

refsect2.title: The :header-image child property
refsect2.para: The image that is displayed next to the page.
Set this to NULL to make the sidebar disappear.

refsect2.title: The :page-type child property
refsect2.para: The type of the assistant page.

refsect2.title: The :sidebar-image child property
refsect2.para: Sidebar image for the assistant page.

refsect2.title: The :title child property
refsect2.para: The title that is displayed in the page header.
If title and header-image are both NULL, no header is displayed.

refsect2.title: The :content-padding style property
refsect2.para: Number of pixels around the content pages.

refsect2.title: The :header-padding style property
refsect2.para: Number of pixels around the header.

refsect2.title: The ::apply signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAssistant *assistant, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::apply signal is emitted when the apply button is clicked. The default behavior of the GtkAssistant is to switch to the page after the current page, unless the current page is the last one.

A handler for the ::apply signal should carry out the actions for which the wizard has collected data. If the action takes a long time to complete, you might consider to put a page of type GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_PROGRESS after the confirmation page and handle this operation within the ::prepare signal of the progress page.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ::cancel signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAssistant *assistant, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::cancel signal is emitted when then the cancel button is clicked.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ::close signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAssistant *assistant, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::close signal is emitted either when the close button of a summary page is clicked, or when the apply button in the last page in the flow (of type GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONFIRM) is clicked.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ::prepare signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAssistant *assistant, GtkWidget *page, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::prepared signal is emitted when a new page is set as the assistant's current page, before making the new page visible. A handler for this signal can do any preparation which are necessary before showing page.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
